text: Fargo is a 1996 American black comedy-drama crime thriller movie. The Coen brothers made this movie, which is set in 1987. Frances McDormand, Steve Buscemi and William H. Macy star in the movie as a detective, a criminal, and a car salesman, respectively. It is a dark comedy about the police investigation of some murders and bad business activities. In 2006 it was put into the United States National Film Registry because the group thought it was culturally, historically, or aesthetically important enough to be recognized in their collection. It inspired a TV series of the same name Part of the movie is set in Fargo, North Dakota. The majority is set in Minneapolis and Brainerd, Minnesota. It shows the culture and accent of many of the people who live there. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1990s black comedy movies Category:1996 comedy-drama movies Category:1996 crime drama movies Category:1996 crime thriller movies Category:1990s criminal comedy movies Category:1996 drama thriller movies Category:Academy Award winning movies Category:American criminal comedy movies Category:American crime drama movies Category:American crime thriller movies Category:American drama thriller movies Category:1990s English-language movies Category:Fargo, North Dakota Category:Film noir Category:Movies set in Minnesota Category:Movies set in 1987 Category:Movies directed by the Coen brothers Category:United States National Film Registry movies Category:Movies set in North Dakota
title: Fargo (1996 movie)
